content.raw:
Based on these changes the integration into `ign-fuelui` is at [this branch ](https://bitbucket.org/mohamd_ayman/ign-fuelui/branch/sdfviewer_integration)

Just open the `ign-fuel` and open any model, -preferably the `number 1` model because it is the only model that has its texture on the staging server-.

The `gui` might need further optimization, and removing JQuery dependency would benefit the integration.
content.html:
Based on these changes the integration into ign-fuelui is at this branch

Just open the ign-fuel and open any model, -preferably the number 1 model because it is the only model that has its texture on the staging server-.

The gui might need further optimization, and removing JQuery dependency would benefit the integration.

content.raw: Is this a subset of `gzgui.js`? I think we should avoid duplication and separate `gzgui` into 2 files, one with only the things needed by the sdf viewer, and another one with everything else on top. GzWeb would use both, but the SDF viewer would only use the simple one. What do you think?
content.html: Is this a subset of gzgui.js? I think we should avoid duplication and separate gzgui into 2 files, one with only the things needed by the sdf viewer, and another one with everything else on top. GzWeb would use both, but the SDF viewer would only use the simple one. What do you think?

content.raw: The new way of using this function seems to be "if `modelName` is undefined, it will load from `customUris`". But what if both are undefined? What if both are *defined*? The API is a bit confusing. We could either document it or somehow split the function. And we should definitely handle the case when neither is defined, because then we will make a request to `this.MATERIAL_ROOT + '//model.sdf'`
